title.rendered: Oanda Japan Changing Margin Requirements Again Amid Covid-19

content.rendered:
The Japan based operations of the popular Canadian broker, Oanda have indicated to customers that they will be changing margin requirements for some products again in light of the spread of Covid-19 disruptions around the world and their impact on global financial markets.

As of April 13, 2020, the following changes will take place:

  • Increase in minimum margin requirement for AUD/SGD from 2% to 3%
  • Increase in minimum margin requirement for AUD/CAD from 2% to 3%
  • Increase in minimum margin requirement for CAD/JPY from 2% to 3%

Customers holding positions in any of the above-mentioned pairs are advised to check whether they have sufficient funds to maintain open positions. Traders should always be aware of ways to limit their trading risks in times of high market volatility – to find out more, check out our guide on Managing Trading Risks During Market Volatility.
